body_html:
Richard, thanks for the suggestion, but, as mentioned in the issue report, I have installed the 9.0 library manually and it works. I am not willing to scratch everything to test. By the way, I don't remember all the tests I did before finding the workaround, but I think that I tried the one you suggest. Quoting Richard Zou <notifications@github.com>:
Try conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch ? — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub[1], or mute the thread[2].

Richard,

thanks for the suggestion, but, as mentioned in the issue report, I
have installed the 9.0 library manually and it works. I am not willing
to scratch everything to test.
By the way, I don't remember all the tests I did before finding the
workaround, but I think that I tried the one you suggest.

Quoting Richard Zou <notifications@github.com>:
 Try conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch ?

body:
Richard,

thanks for the suggestion, but, as mentioned in the issue report, I  
have installed the 9.0 library manually and it works. I am not willing  
to scratch everything to test.
By the way, I don't remember all the tests I did before finding the  
workaround, but I think that I tried the one you suggest.

Quoting Richard Zou <notifications@github.com>:

> Try conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch ?

>   —
